website_summaries.verdict: Designed for the serious archer, this durable target can take thousands of shots from a compound bow.
pros: enough to takes thousand of shots
Handle and grommets for easy transportation and hanging

customer_reviews.title: Great for arrows. Bears don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: This target was great for my 45# recurve bow and my 175# crossbow. The grommets were perfect for hanging on my stand. After just a month a bear decided to destroy the target, along with a less effective foam target I had. I'm not sure what bears have against archery targets, but they are both wrecked. If you are wondering what's inside, it's like a huge blanket was squeezed into the target. I'll post a picture. I'll be reordering the target and storing it inside.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Over thousands of shoots, this bag is still standing
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely will buy this bag again. I put over 2500 shoots on one side and this bag is still holding up very good. Absolutely I can still put other 1000 more on it before I turn it over for other side. I do use a paper target on top because the printing is all fade out after few hundred shoots. Pulling arrow out from this bag is much easier than these foam type targets. My bow is Hoyt Carbon Spyder with 50lb draw. Update, over 5000 shoots on both side, the bag is still useable but some area are too weak to hold the shot, the arrow when through.
customer_reviews.author: PK9394Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one weekend .
customer_reviews.text: This target goes from super firm that it ate the tips of one of my arrows to so soft my arrows just sag down. I end up shooting the nocks off many arrows because of how soft this target gets. I've shot it hundreds of times and it takes hit after hit but quickly becomes way to soft. It's annoying to hit dead center of any of the bullseye and have the arrow sag making a follow up shot impossible. You can turn the target around to expose a good side and it will take another few hundred impacts. I shoot a lot, I wore this out in a weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Randall BryanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great portable target for traditional bow practice
customer_reviews.text: Nicely constructed and large surface area for field target practice. There are grommets on the top to hang on a stand but I just lay it on the ground when we take it to the target range (I do prop it up with something in the back). Its a good value target for the price and It’s been holding up great so far shooting 30lb off my recurve.
customer_reviews.author: HotPotJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Did not even try to use
customer_reviews.text: Item received was proper height and width but the depth was short. I put Target on level flat hard wood floor and can easily poke it with my finger and knock it over. Not going to even take the chance of shooting at it and it then would be unreturnable . Had to send it back as I just can't take any chances and really don't seeing back up knocked over targets. Besides feeling unstable it could be doable if you set it up against a tree (better shoot strait) have 2 other targets that were described as skinnier but they are obviously thicker and much more stable and almost 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert bose

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: I bought this target bock in March of 2016. It stays outside all the time. I made a sawhorse looking stand to hang it from. I've probably shot it 1,000's of times and it still works! Whenever I notice my arrows going too deep into it, I just pick it up and angle it to the left or to the right, and keep on shooting. I'm thinking, I may never need another target.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Really Amazed by this target
customer_reviews.text: Hi have used a good number of targets over the years, and thought for the price and reviews I would give it a go. Shooting @ 20 yards, 287fps, 400+ gr arrow, stops the arrow and I can remove it with literally two fingers. At the price I purchased another. Highly recommend. Have been using and still have, a product that is a good stopping the arrows, costs three times more, and you have to pull like crazy to get the arrow loose.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Shepherdson

customer_reviews.title: Great target for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've shot probably 100 arrows into this so far and it's been great. I shoot a 65lb compound bow with 350 spine arrows and they don't even think about wanting to go through, but they do go in pretty far. I'd say 2 out of 5 arrows I shoot are a little tough to pull but nothing unmanageable. It's a great size for pretty long shots too. Reasonably visible near 50yrds. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Conan

customer_reviews.title: This will last a long time..
customer_reviews.text: This archery bag will last forever using field points. They pull out with such ease (can pull the arrows out with just two fingers). The only downsides are the weight of the bag and the bag tipping over easily. But because of how well it holds up, how easy it is to remove, and the price point... VERY happy with this purchase! (PS: don't leave it in the cab of your truck overnight or your truck will smell quite foul in the morning)
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: The target I didn't know I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great target. It stops the arrows quickly, consistently, yet they pull out with two fingers (as their video indicated). I can't go back to the foam block I have used for years. The fabric gets a little dinged up with time in center spots, but it sort of heals from the arrow holes to a large extent. The high contrast colors help, and the size saves me when I do anything stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Roger G

customer_reviews.title: Easiest 2 finger pull ever
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this target!!! I'm shooting a compound bow, about 55lb draw, shots went in maybe 5 inches (just a guess) but pulled out easily with two fingers, no effort. I have used so many targets that you have to pull and tug with even only 30lbs of pressure they get stuck. Not this, this was a delight. Super cheap price wise, quality product, heavy but expected, get it
customer_reviews.author: Queens, NY Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good target
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good target. I’m shooting a 65LBS compound bow and it stops the arrows without damage and they are easy to remove. My only complaint is there is no eyelets to connect to the bottom to stop it from swinging. I hang it from a permanent stand made from 4X4’s and it gets to swinging when two people are shooting or when the wind comes up. I know they sell a stand, however I prefer mine. Other than that it does its job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hotel rooms!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a hotel room almost year round. But I shoot a longbow and needed a way to shoot when I can't get to an actual range or shoot behind a hotel. So I bought this bag to to shoot in my hotel room. It works great for working on form and technique and keeps my muscles strong. I shoot a Black Widow at 53# and the bag stops the arrows. The size is perfect so there's no chance that I'll miss! Arrows pull out easy. A luggage rack makes a great stand!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Dubé

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your dollar. Nothing bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.text: Is perfect for the price. One of the cheapest I could find that weren't for youth. My draw is set hard at 60LB and I'm shooting Easton 6mm FMJ Arrows. From 20-55yrd and it's holding up great after a month of soothing almost every day. Its easy to move from ground to air with the Grommets I rigged mine up so it swings from side to side a few feet. Make it's more a bit more challenging gotta get ready for Turkey season..
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great target for the money. Holds up to occasional practice expandables
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the layered foam blocks which are great but for the price don't hold up as good. This target had seen about 150 arrows on one side and still looks brand new plus I have shot the expandable practice heads a handful of times just to make sure they are true and haven't had any issues. They do take a small amount of filling out and may take a few seconds to work them out but there is no need to shoot them more than 4 or 5 shots just to check. I don't keep mine outside so it has held up great for the last 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Jacon Colwell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent target and Bacjstop. Love mine!
customer_reviews.text: Killer target, I use it as part of a backstop as well. I have a crossbow at a 180LBs. Yellow jacket stops 400 grain arrows with no problems. Easy to pull out and doesn't leave a huge hole. Has a nice handle, so just grab and go when you're finished. Overall very happy I got this and is my new go to target/backstop. Price is very reasonable!
customer_reviews.author: The Pusher

customer_reviews.title: but holy moly is this target awesome! When it showed up
customer_reviews.text: I do not really write product reviews, but holy moly is this target awesome! When it showed up, its lightweight(compared to other targets) and "squishiness" lead me to believe that it did not stand a chance of stopping my arrows out of my barnett crossbows. This thing not only stops them, they pull out of the target with two fingers worth of effort. I think morrell stuffs these things with magic! My old "block"y target would allow the crossbow bolts to pass all the way through it, and into the plywood behind it. With the morrell yellow jacket, the bolts only penetrate about halfway. Get one now! you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa DeLisle

customer_reviews.title: Good target but..
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to sight in my crossbow. I shot about 30 bolts at approximately 125 feet. Most entered halfway through the target and were easily removed. As seen in the picture, one did pass completely through and went about 3 inches into a fence post.
customer_reviews.author: G-f-v

customer_reviews.title: Good target— avoid bulb field points.
customer_reviews.text: A large archery target designed to take some punishment. Make sure you get an arrow puller alongside this target— the filling can make it difficult to get some field points out of it, especially if they have a bulb shoulder. The top handle is weak, so it’s best to just use some paracord to lift it by the hanging grommets on the sides. It’ll stop an arrow out of a 60lb compound no problem, but then again, getting the arrows back will be a different story.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up 👍
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a bow hunter for over 20 years and we fling a lot of arrows all year long. This is the best feild point target. It’s durable and it’s super easy to pull arrows out of. This is the 2nd one I purchased. Me and my friends set up a out door 3d shooting range and use these to sight out bows in. So we got about 10 guys shooting this target once per week for 6 months out of the years. It’s a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It will stop a high velocity arrow
customer_reviews.text: What I dislike about the target is some areas on the target the arrow can be removed easily. Other areas on the target you have to twist and jerk on the arrow to remove. No matter what distance you are shooting. A hand held arrow remover and eye protection is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great target!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic! After target practice, my son asked me what the target was made of. I asked him why he asked. He shared he never saw anything with the holes closing in on itself after pulling out the arrow. He really liked it. I smiled and told him that is part of the design of this best selling target. Although this may be set on the ground, we did set out an old folding ladder and strapped the target to it just for the practice. Better than chancing shooting the arrows into the ground...which my husband did...hence the ladder. My son is a quite the marksman with the compound bow...unlike his dad. LOL! You'll enjoy this target as we are!
customer_reviews.author: DaiToday

customer_reviews.title: Durable Target, Not So Much for Target Points
customer_reviews.text: Great target that holds up and took hundreds of arrows without much wear and tear. The main issue is that the cover tends to snag on field points and would sometimes pull your tips right off. If you're unlucky, the point will get lodged into the target and basically render it useless until dug back out. Because of that, you run the risk of hitting an embedded point and ruining your other arrows. Also note that the cover is quite tough and was a bit of a challenge for me to pin a target face down. But overall, this is a very good target for a wide variety of bows.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Evil

customer_reviews.title: Bottom of bag not secure!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son’s 15 birthday and haven’t used it yet as his birthday is next week. Not sure how long it will last as when received the staples holding the bottom together have ripped the fabric and are not holding it tightly. Can’t return it as don’t want to miss the chance of not having a target for his birthday so going to have to stick it out and hope it holds together.
customer_reviews.author: Kato

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice target
customer_reviews.text: It has enough weight to it that it doesn't move when hit. . It stops the arrows perfectly, never letting them go in too deep. . And it's always easy to remove them, too. . Can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: mark m.

customer_reviews.title: Great Target
customer_reviews.text: So far this target has been worth the money. It's easy to cart around and set up, and it's well Made. I was concerned that the repetitive impacts would quickly make the rivets that you hang it from rip, but they are still in perfect shape after 6 months of solid use. You can also buy replacement covers for this target, which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: David FazzariTop Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with my new Yellow Jacket. I have had a YJ bag for years and it has held up well. Needed another bag target so I went with what I know. Target works fine in that it stops arrows, however, it leaves a rubbery residue on my arrows. It's not that big of a deal, just an inconvenience and time waster (cleaning off arrows - and you can't get it all off easily).
customer_reviews.author: doughboy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this target would be a 5/5 for a regular bow, but I bought it for my crossbow that is shooting pretty hot. After about 5 consistant shots in the center the bolts started to go through, but all in all as long as you dont shoot the crap out of this target in the same spot you have got yourself a good target.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps not durable enough for crossbows at 185 pound draw weight
customer_reviews.text: This is the first archery target that I've bought so not sure if this is normal but bolts shoot through the target and get stuck with the field point sticking out from the back using my Centerpoint 370 Sniper at 50 yards. One bolt is stuck so bad I can't even pull it out. Maybe there are more durable ones out there on the market for a 185 pound draw weight crossbow?
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: bigger than I though
customer_reviews.text: Larger than I thought it would be but that is a good thing.It stops the arrows fast and they are surprisingly easy to remove. it is a little loud when the arrows hit but to to the point of a problem. when it wears out I will re-bag it or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: toptecone

customer_reviews.title: hold up to a 45# bow
customer_reviews.text: Makes a nice sound when hit right, down side is the staples at the bottom are falling out. using duct tape to help hold the bottom seams together . :-( Otherwise, it is okay.
customer_reviews.author: parzival

customer_reviews.title: Great in every way
customer_reviews.text: This is by far a superior target to the foam targets I'd been using. It laughs at crossbow bolts at any distance, and takes shots from my compound bow without moving. It has heavy-duty tabs with grommets for hanging, but right now I'm sitting it on the ground or on hay bales.This is a big, heavy-duty target that I expect to last. The best part is that I paid at least $15 less than at the big box sporting goods store locally.
customer_reviews.author: JL Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, but definitely will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: At first this target was great. Arrows would pull very easily. Now after just a month of light to moderate use, the arrows are very hard to pull and the target is leaving a fibrous glue type residue on my arrows which is very hard to clean off. Using harsh chemicals on my arrows to remove this residue didn't even help. It will barely even come off when scraped with a knife blade. I know morrell is a quality and well known brand, so it just might be the one target that's doing this.
customer_reviews.author: Mdawg30

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT DELIVERY SPEED!!
customer_reviews.text: First, the delivery speed was astounding. I ordered the bag on a Monday night, and it was delivered Tuesday afternoon. I hate waiting for anything, and Amazon insured I didn't. The bag is very stout, and will stand by itself without a hanger. Arrows come out with a solid tug, and this thing will provide years of service. Well made. Definitely worth the investment of you're in the market for a target.
customer_reviews.author: Kim chatman

customer_reviews.title: Very durable! Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughters 9th birthday and it is everything I was hoping for! Very durable a little heavy to maneuver, however, I am 6 months pregnant. This is an overall great product if you are looking for a long lasting target to practice with!
customer_reviews.author: Boymom

customer_reviews.title: Good crossbow target
customer_reviews.text: Good crossbow target...for the money.So far, this target has met my expectations. I have a Barnett Jackal crossbow rated at 315fps using 20" bolts and 100-125gr fieldtips...it will bury the bolts more than halfway into this target @ 20yds. Using a broadhead practice head will tear up the innards of this target, so suggest using those in moderation. Overall, I am pleased and can see this lasting for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: zofoman

customer_reviews.title: A hit; a palpable hit
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my aspiring-archer-nephew. Great target. Easy for removal of target points. Seems to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Jboobe

customer_reviews.title: Won't stop arrows
customer_reviews.text: Have no more than 100 shots into this and I'm getting way too many pass throughs, ridiculous. Shooting 60 lbs and 27.5" draw, so it's not like the bow is crazy hot...
customer_reviews.author: Scott USMC

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: This target is decent. Not great. It's not very thick so the durability isn't there to stop too many arrows that hit the same general spot. I used the target for maybe 200 shots before my arrows would penetrate down to the fetchings.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Right on target!!
customer_reviews.text: Great target. Yes, there are some arrow holes in the material. No, they don't all close up and disappear. It is an archery target, what do you expect? My son and I have been shooting compound bows and crossbow bolts with field points and the target looks like it will last for years. Yes, it will stop a crossbow bolt with a field point from a 350 fps Barnett Crossbow at 15 yds.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Nice target, targets off center.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived well packaged. When I pulled it from the box, and bag I noticed first that it was faded. The second thing I noticed was that the red targets are all on the lower part of the target, not centered. So, if you use them you'll be shooting into the bottom of the bag. Since I plan to put my own target on this one it won't be a problem for me, but, it is something that should be corrected by the manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: HFL

customer_reviews.title: heavy
customer_reviews.text: holds the arrows in place, maybe a little too well. Heavy bag! Won't topple over. Should hold up for a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Love this Target Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag has held up well with over 1,200 arrows (Field Tips) shot into it. The bag weighs 45 pounds so lugging it around is a bit of a pain. It will occasionally tip over if an arrow hits above the lettering but for the most part it stays put. Removing field tips from it is very easy. It has targets on both sides (same pattern) as well as reinforced eyelets so it can be hung (from the top corners of the target)
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: I just love this target! We've used other brands and the arrows are hard to remove and get stuck but not in this one! The arrows are so easy to pull out, markings stand out and easy to see from distance. The bag can sit on the ground or be mounted on a hanging stand. I'll definitely get a Morrell target if I need one in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Nona G.

customer_reviews.title: Buzz Worthy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Comes out of the box ready to use. Really durable and can take a beating. Would highly recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: P. T.

customer_reviews.title: Good target. Hard to see bullseye.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I’m giving it 3 stars is because the “bullseyes” are so difficult to see beyond 10-20 yards. Otherwise it is a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Todd S.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the back yard
customer_reviews.text: The arrows usually pull out easily. Sometimes they do get snagged and either damage the arrows or rip the target. It’s a better target than the styrofoam block but not as good as many others
customer_reviews.author: bobj401

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for constant practice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 12 y/o. This thing stays together with no sign of coming apart which was my fear when spending that much on a target. I thought it may last 4-5 months but I've had it for more than a year with constant use each 1-2 weeks and it looks like it did the day it arrived. I do place it in my enclosed trailer after each use instead of letting it get weathered in the yard like I've seen others do. This seems to make all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: First off, it actually arrived early, which was nice. Based on the 50 or so arrows I shot at it yesterday, I think it will hold up great. I'm shooting a compound at 62lbs and they're nowhere near going through. Removal is easy also. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W.

customer_reviews.title: Good target
customer_reviews.text: I shot about 50 arrows into it, and then left it outside in the rain and heat. Aside from the holes this puppy looks li,e the day I got it. Arrows co e out super easy provided the tip is the same size or smaller than the shaft.
customer_reviews.author: Stizan

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely buy it again, but may not need to with how durable it seems to be!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome target. I'm a beginner in the sport of archery and spent an hour on Amazon looking at targets. The reviews on this product convinced me to make the purchase. I am so happy that I did! It is easy to transport and set up, and seems to be very durable. Other customers claimed that this target lasted them for several years, and I plan to put that to the test! I would definitely recommend this target to anyone looking to buy a durable and decently priced target.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag style target/perfect size!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Super strong, very simple, easy to carry/transport, takes one hell of a beating, IMO it's a much better value and will last WAAAAYYYY longer than the layerd block foam style targets. Great buy no regrets at all and will 100% buy another if I ever ware this sucker out... Almost forgot, I've never had an easier time pulling arrows out of anything in my life. They sink in maybe 4in an literally is as easy as picking an arrow out of a piece of cardboard, takes almost 0 effort it's fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Nice target
customer_reviews.text: Love it I may go for the bigger one 100 yard shots with my compound 70lbs 5 feet away does no go through but alot of melted plastic on the arrow at that distance shoot 50 yard regular at it think I want a stand for it now
customer_reviews.author: chris wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Carry Strap, Not Issue But Darn
customer_reviews.text: Large and heavy target, that’s good. Black carry strap arrived detached on one side, can’t carry weight. Not worth exchange hassle. Will attach rope/chain for handle/hanger. Will see how it stands up and releases bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Staples to hold the bottom together look like possibly a blind person put them in... no offense but how do they expect to charge so much money for such horrible quality. Asked to return it since it’s not what I was expecting and they said they couldn’t help me. Also took almost a week and half for them to “help” me with my problem. Will no longer be buying morrel targets
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Queen

customer_reviews.title: The bolts are easy to remove
customer_reviews.text: I puchased this target bag to practice with my crossbow. The size is nice and large and the 5 front bullseyes are well marked. Shooting in the basement at around 17 yards the bolts are quite easy to remove and I am pleased with this purchase. I recommend the Morrell Yellow jacket field point Bag for crossbow use.
customer_reviews.author: Davo68

customer_reviews.title: Great 👍 target
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I've always wanted to shoot a bow in my back yard. And now I can. The target resist damage and kinda seals itself. Arrows are retained from shooting a compound bow.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Larson

customer_reviews.title: For Field Point Tips Only
customer_reviews.text: Luckily the arrows I bought came with field tips because I didnt realize this target was not rated for broad heads. Besides my slight overlook this target has been holding up great. I am shooting with a 40# recurve bow with Easton genesis arrows and I have been shooting from 7-20 yards. The arrows are very easy to pull from the target as long as you pull straight back.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised I use it for indoor practice
customer_reviews.text: During these times of the Covid Virus this Target allows me to practice with 30# bow in my basement.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It looks like the bottom will easily fall out if the target ...
customer_reviews.text: Received today. As reported elsewhere the staple job across the the bottom that holds everything in is VERY SHODDY. 90%of the staples are excessively protruding from the surface and don't look to be very well closed at all. It looks like the bottom will easily fall out if the target is left touching the ground, or even if suspended in a frame. My first impression is disappointment but I do hope it lives up to its reputation.
customer_reviews.author: deweydf

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. Stops bolts from my 160lb Crossbow. Have zero complaints on this one.
customer_reviews.author: aptat2

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: awesome, holds up well. I have a 165 pound crossbow and the field point arrows don't go through this target. At the same time, the arrows are pretty easy to pull out. Comparing this to a target I made full of cardboards, this is way better because the arrows are next to impossible to pull out with the cardboard target
customer_reviews.author: E. Kung

customer_reviews.title: Great Targets!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality at an affordable price. Own several Morrell targets, and in the end, they offer superior quality and durability compared to their competitors. Be realistic with how long the target should last, however, 2-3 years of continuous shooting with high performance equipment (compound bow) is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Morrell 104 Yellowjacket F/P
customer_reviews.text: Larger that I was expecting which is GOOD. Nice strong handle on the top. Well made. I have a Barnett Wildcat C5 Crossbow which packs a pretty good punch. This target bag is large enough and tough enough to take the hundreds of hits from my bow & there is really no visible wear or damage. The holes sorta self seal due to the weave of the bags tough material. I keep mine in the garage when no being used. I can't confirm it but I suspect if left out in the weather for months on end, the coloring may fade Overall a great punching bag for my Barnett Wilcat.
customer_reviews.author: Pjack

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag taken a lot of hits so far and still in good shape
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Arrows are easy to pull out.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped Tenpoint crossbow bolts easily and the bolts are easy to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Bartkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Great target for my crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Great target for my crossbow, Barnett Quad Edge 125lb draw. Easy 2 finger removable. The bag got a bit worn out (after 100s and 100s of shots) so I covered the target with duck tape, good as new. Not for broad heads. I tried and there is no getting them out. I few 1000 or so more shots and I will buy another. Has been a better target than what I expected when I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and seems to last forever for my 35# longbow at 20 yards. Probably 2000+ arrows and only now the center is getting softer, but the bag still looks good. It probably says more about my shootings skills, if all 2000 shots were in the center one could probably see through is :-)
customer_reviews.author: T M

customer_reviews.title: Great Target
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this with 25lb recurve at 18 yards. Will stick target. Sometimes they penetrate and fall limp. Moving up to 35 lbs this week. All in All great backyard target. Plenty of material for a more powerful bow
customer_reviews.author: G Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this target bag with high hopes. When I opened the box, the handle strap was already split in two. I had a planned archery practice session that I needed the target for so I'm stuck with it. The target is large and heavy so it is difficult to transport without a working strap. It does not appear to be a sturdy strap to begin with. Not purchasing this again, I'll spend the money on a higher quality target.
customer_reviews.author: Tt

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my camp so I could shoot during the season. No problem stopping arrows from my 60# Mathews and removal is a breeze. I keep it in my shed and pull it out when I want to shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: Still great. Color faded a little but still works great
customer_reviews.text: Very durable! This stays outside in the sun, rain, snow. It took a beating from many arrows. Still great. Color faded a little but still works great. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: Target
customer_reviews.text: Good archery target. I can’t tell how difficult it is to pull the arrows out, as I have yet to hit the target with an arrow.
customer_reviews.author: HannahofIN

customer_reviews.title: great bag
customer_reviews.text: great bag for the price! No need to worry about arrow going all the way through and they are easy to remove!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Bear magnet, contains coffee bean burlap sacks
customer_reviews.text: This bag (or at least mine) is a bear magnet. It contains several green coffee bean burlap sacks and bears will be able to smell that from quite some distance. Needless to say my target was ripped open and disemboweled by a bear within a month of purchase. I assume most people Intend to use it outdoors...everything else about the bag was fine
customer_reviews.author: lisa ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pull arrows
customer_reviews.text: Morrell makes great targets. I had a Stinger target before this Supreme. I got a new cover for the Stinger. Even the Stinger which I've had for almost 2 yrs, looks and works like a new one. ( added a little more stuffing ) The only negative I have with the Supreme is the arrows seem to penetrate more than the Stinger with the same bow and draw weight. Some arrows almost poked through the other side. Still works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdy Rick

customer_reviews.title: The outer shell is hard to penetrate with kids' practice ...
customer_reviews.text: The outer shell is hard to penetrate with kids' practice arrow, but I guess that's just a temporary issue. Will see how long this thing can last under the strong sun.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDwellerTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent target. The size is good and its not too heavy to move around and the arrows (field points) come out so easily. Its holding up very well after a couple of weeks and seems to be very durable. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Cone

customer_reviews.title: Good target for the price but not as durable as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: Very nice target but didn't last as long as I'd like. After about a year of consistent use the center has been shot out on both sides. I'm going to attempt to empty all internal packing and repack. In the mean time I bought a Block target that appears it will hold up much better!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Super, easy pull, stands well.
customer_reviews.text: Super target. Easy pull. Stands up well on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great field point target
customer_reviews.text: Holds up to my crossbow bolts which travel about 350fps. Even does well at 15 yards. Have only had about 1/200 bolts over penetrate. I'm used to using the block foam targets and I feel like bolts are pulled from this target with much less effort. Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH BETTER THAN THE FOAM BLOCKS
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this brand of target before and really like how easy the arrows are to remove, arrows make a satisfying thump when hitting the target.
customer_reviews.author: robert s

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD, TOUGH TARGET
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my 7-year old can practice with his bow in the backyard. It has grommets so it can be hung from a frame, but we just set it on a sawhorse in front of a barndoor. This is one tough target! My son uses a 24-pound draw bow, and at full draw the practice arrows don't always penetrate the first layer!
customer_reviews.author: Mo H.

customer_reviews.title: works great for 380 fps.
customer_reviews.text: Note the dimensions... This was much larger than I expected. It's a decent sized target and it has no problem stopping bolts from my 380 fps crossbow. Removing arrows is pretty easy and can be done with two fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian AfficianatoTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly durable. I changed from the Black Hole target block which had quality issues. The Yellow Jacket is more durable and can be taken down and worked back into shape every 1000 arrows or so. I have used it with field points. Will reorder next time.
customer_reviews.author: Leitz

customer_reviews.title: Great target and a bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Great taget!!! All I own are field tipped arrows and they penetrate just a few inches coming out of my 55# compound bow. I'm teaching my daughter archery, and the arrows sometimes don't stick in the target coming out of a 25# stick bow. No big deal to me as she will soon graduate to to 40# compound bow.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Pine

customer_reviews.title: Great target, sturdy, surprisingly light
customer_reviews.text: Love this target. Best bag target I ever had. Lightweight but very study. Takes the shots well, firmly holding the arrow, yet very easy to pull. Way better than the old Morell cloth target I had which immediately got extremely heavy and started ripping in the weather after shooting it. This one has a much more substantial cover and light weight but dense enough packing
customer_reviews.author: BuffaloSoldier

customer_reviews.title: You Get what You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Supreme III about 7 weeks ago and have literally worn it out in practice sessions over that period of time. Admittedly, I have put well over a thousand arrows into it. The center is shot out, the stopping media has migrated to the bottom of the bag, and it no longer repels water. It is a decent target for the price but longevity is an issue. I believe I’d have been money ahead buying a more expensive, longer lasting target.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Gibson

customer_reviews.title: The best choice for target arrows
customer_reviews.text: The best choice for target arrows, this target with the HME stand and the target cover costs less than just a single foam type target. I have been shooting the crap out of it and it is holding up very well. I could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Eliason

customer_reviews.title: More than skin deep
customer_reviews.text: Two finger removal? More like two hands. 50-60% penetration with a 40# round wheel target bow. Quite a mystery, considering how bizzarely heavy this bag is.
customer_reviews.author: linsey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice target! I just put it on the chair.. Arrows are easy to remove. The only thing which I didn't expect - the sound when arrow hits the target is a little bit loud. However, after few weeks of use, the middle of the target became more quiet, cause I think that yellow cover became more thin :)
customer_reviews.author: Filament

customer_reviews.title: Staples on bottom look rough
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. I know Morrell makes some great targets but this one came out of the box or from the factory with the stables on the bottom of the target already falling out and looking a little rough.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Whitehad

customer_reviews.title: Rockin Stoppin Yellow Jacket
customer_reviews.text: This stops bolts from my Barnett Raptor FX crossbow @ 330 fps at 10 and 20 yards and come out without any problems. The bolts normally stop several inches away from the fletch. I did have one bolt sink in up to the fletch but it pulled out easily. This is a field point target so no broadhead tests.
customer_reviews.author: Rick K SE MIchigan

customer_reviews.title: excellent target. Much larger than I anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Wow, excellent target. Much larger than I anticipated. When you first start using it shoot around the entire target. It pushes down the interior uniformly. You'll see when you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've put a couple of hundred arrows into this product since ordering it. It's worked great. Held up to the arrows very well. Coupled with the HME Archery Bag Target Stand, it's been a great addition to my home range.
customer_reviews.author: BowHunter60

customer_reviews.title: Good Target
customer_reviews.text: We use this to practice spear throwing and it is awesome! Highly recommend. Holds up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Do not use broadheads
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the best field point target. This thing stops arrows with only 2 to 3 inch penetration and is easy to remove. I shoot a Elite energy 35 with 70lb draw weight. I also love the block targets for broadheads, however they destroy the blocks. That being said do not use broadheads like they say or you will destroy the target. I recommend getting the stand also.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Good target!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this target. Stops every arrow no problem and they pull out easy peasy. Once in a while the arrows almost bounce out and they protrude from the target at odd angles (i think because of the uneven stuffing inside). Thats kinda annoying. Besides that, its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Collin

customer_reviews.title: Great target!
customer_reviews.text: After a months of target practice, it has held up quite nice. I am glad I purchased it so far. I probably would have preferred, a normal target instead of the 4 small target's but as I progress as an archer, I have a feeling I will like the 4 small targets, as I am sure it will help spread the wear on the target.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it's new not used with a new cover
customer_reviews.text: It said brand new item. But when taken out of the box it appears to be a used Target with a new cover on it the stapling on the bottom is horrible bought one a few years ago from local archery shop that was not stapled on the bottom it was sewn so obviously it's not brand new
customer_reviews.author: Bridget P.

product_meta.title: Morrell Yellow Jacket Supreme 3 Field Point Bag Archery Target
feature_bullets: ARCHERY TARGET designed for a high speed COMPOUND BOW that takes THOUSANDS OF SHOTS
Field point only BOW AND ARROW TARGET - LONGER LIFE ARCHERY TARGETS
EASY ARROW REMOVAL - known for TWO FINGER ARROW REMOVAL
HANDLE AND GROMMETS included for EASY TRANSPORT AND HANGING to extend target life
DURABLE, MADE IN THE USA and HIGH VISIBILITY TARGET DESIGN for sighting in

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
